intro: Scytalis tenuis, commonly known as the slender scytalis, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of its family. Scytalis tenuis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
